comments:
In the Web Service wizard, when doing a "Bottom up Java Bean Web Service"
generation, the command fails with ClassNotFoundException if the java class
is inside a jar file.

To reproduce:
=============

1) create a new dynamic web project
2) import the attached test.jar file into the WebContent/WEB-INF/lib folder
3) goto File -> New -> Other -> Web Services -> Web Service (Next)
4) browse for the Dummy2 class in the Service Implementation field (this class
   comes from test.jar)
5) Select Tomcat 5.0 server
5) click Finish

A dialog box will pop up with the following error:

IWAB0398E Error in generating WSDL from Java:  java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: test.Dummy2
    java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: test.Dummy2

Created an attachment (id=46033)
test.jar file containing the Dummy2 class

We don't handle jars in referenced projects, but jars in WEB-INF/lib should automagically be added to the project's build path which is subsequently given to the Axis emitters.

Andrew, after step #2 in your scenario, would you please check the project's build path properties page to see if the jar shows up there?

The test.jar file does show up in the projects's build path properties page.  Additionally, when stepping through the code in debug view, the classpath passed to the Emitter class does contain the path to the test.jar file.

Tracing through the code shows that the Dummy2 class could not load and the class loader was throwing an error:

java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: test/Dummy2 (Unsupported major.minor version 50.0)

It turns out that the problem is in the class itself, it looks like it was compiled with an incompatible jdk.  I was able to re-create the jar file with a properly compiled class file which passes the described scenario.
